variants.Description in input context: p.G2019S (LRRK2 variant associated with Parkinson's disease)
p.N370S (GBA variant associated with Gaucher disease)
p.A4T (SOD1 variant associated with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis)

Described Disease.Described Disease: Parkinson's disease, Gaucher disease, Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and variant LRRK2 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2 p.G2019S exhibited increased kinase activity compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 10% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 30% of wild-type control.

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from Gaucher disease patients
Material used.Description: Tissue samples were analyzed for GBA p.N370S accumulation.

Readout description.Result Description: GBA p.N370S showed reduced enzyme activity and increased glucosylceramide accumulation.

Biological replicates.Description: Five tissue samples from Gaucher disease patients were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each slide was analyzed in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type GBA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Control samples were not explicitly mentioned.

Validation controls B/LB.Description: No benign variant controls were reported.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test comparing mutant vs. wild-type samples.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Glucosylceramide levels within 20% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Glucosylceramide levels exceeding 50% of wild-type control.

Material used.Description: Cells were transfected with SOD1 variants and luciferase reporter constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: SOD1 p.A4T induced increased oxidative stress and neuronal death compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Four independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SOD1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Mann-Whitney U test comparing mutant vs. wild-type samples.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oxidative stress levels within 15% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Oxidative stress levels exceeding 40% of wild-type control.
